source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_032_chunk1
evidence_span: It is shown that, to initiate an unstable fast fracture during operation of Zircaloy-2 pressure tubes used in the Steam Generating Heavy Water Reactor, a defect more than 4 in. long and having a depth 80 percent through the wall has to be present.

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_032_chunk1
evidence_span: The effect of hydrides oriented in both the circumferential and radial directions is discussed, and it is concluded that the hydrogen absorbed during a 30 year life should have no significant effect on the critical defect size.

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_032_chunk1
evidence_span: Simlarly, it is shown that fast neutron damage will not have a deleterious effect on the critical defect size.

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_032_chunk1
evidence_span: The pressure tubes pass through calandria tubes which are an integral part of the tank, and a carbon dioxide gas blanket between the pressure tubes and calandria tubes provides insulation and allows the moderator to be maintained at a low temperature (~80°C).
